Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial of Polidocanol Foam Sclerotherapy vs. Conventional Surgery for Varicose Veins

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were non-randomly assigned to PFS (57 patients, 90 legs) or CS (148 patients, 236 legs).

Participants.evidence: 205 patients were enrolled from two public health institutions in São Paulo, Brazil

Intervention.evidence: compare the effectiveness of polidocanol foam sclerotherapy (PFS) and conventional surgery (CS)

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare the effectiveness of polidocanol foam sclerotherapy (PFS) and conventional surgery (CS) for treating lower limb varicose veins using Patient-Reported Outcome Measures (PROMs).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in Venous Clinical Severity Score (VCSS) and VEINES-QoL/Sym scores, assessed preoperatively and 30 days post-treatment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 205 patients were enrolled from two public health institutions in São Paulo, Brazil, between October 2021 and October 2022.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Participants were non-randomly assigned to PFS (57 patients, 90 legs) or CS (148 patients, 236 legs).

Result_Outcome.evidence: CS showed greater improvements in VCSS (mean difference = 4.02, 95% CI 3.1 to 5.0; p < 0.001), VEINES-QoL (mean difference = 8, 95% CI 6.5 to 9.5; p < 0.001), and VEINES-Sym (mean difference = 11.66, 95% CI 9.8 to 13.5; p < 0.001) compared to PFS.

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group.
